abstract: Federal regulators voted to propose new rules that could make it harder for financial firms to disguise their level of debt.
snippet: Federal regulators voted to propose new rules that could make it harder for financial firms to disguise their level of debt.
lead_paragraph: 1:17 p.m. | Updated The Securities and Exchange Commission unanimously approved on Friday a proposal to require companies to disclose more information about their short-term borrowings, aiming to prevent companies from dressing up their balance sheets for quarter-end filings by hiding liquidity problems, Edward Wyatt of The New York Times reports.

headline.main: S.E.C. Proposes New Rules on Debt Maneuvers

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
